title: Anomalous pinch in electron-electron beam collision
authors: W. Zhang, T. Grismayer, and L. O. Silva
abstract:
We show that an anomalous pinch can occur in ultrarelativistic
electron-electron or positron-positron beam interaction, caused by the combined
interplay of collective beam motion (disruption) and strong-field quantum
electrodynamics (SF-QED). The locally created electron-positron pairs, from
SF-QED effects, screen the self-fields of the beams and can invert the polarity
of the Lorentz force resulting in a pinch of the beams. A theoretical model
predicts the pinch condition and is confirmed by first-principles 3-dimensional
particle-in-cell simulations. This anomalous pinch enhances density
compression, increases the collision luminosity, and amplifies the local
magnetic fields and the quantum parameter of the beam particles by several
orders of magnitude.
